awd_titl_txt: Travel: III:  Student Travel Support for 2022 ACM International Conference on Web Search and Data Mining (WSDM)
awd_abstract_narration:
The award enables about 20 US students to attend the 2022 Association of Computing Machinery International Conference on Web Search and Data Mining (WSDM, pronounced "wisdom"), which will be held in Phoenix, Arizona (https://www.wsdm-conference.org/2022/) from February 21 to February 25, 2022. The aim is to support a diverse group of students and make it possible for them to attend the conference and discuss and disseminate their work. The conference also provides an opportunity for them to interact with national and international researchers. 

The WSDM conference, which was established in 2008, brings together researchers and industry practitioners into a comprehensive program for publication, education, and interaction, including research papers, tutorials, doctoral symposium, and a machine learning competition-style event (WSDM cup). The program includes publications relating to web search and data mining defined broadly, and particularly encourages publications on practical yet principled novel models of search and data mining, algorithm design and analysis, economic implications, and in-depth experimental analysis of accuracy and performance. The program also includes workshops that demand dedicated coverage due to their relevance to the current research and development in web search and data mining, and keynote talks by leaders in academia and industry. All these activities provide a unique opportunity for students to share their knowledge, experience, and research projects with internationally recognized researchers from both academia and industry. In recent years, about 500 attendees attended WSDM, and we expect the same this year as well.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The award support students to attend ACM WSDM 2022 and WSDM 2023.  The ACM WSDM 2022 was planned to take place in Phoenix, Arizona, 2/21-2/25, 2022. Due to the pandemic, the conference was moved to a fully virtual structure through official arrangements via ACM with a company, Whova. ACM WSDM 2023 was held in Singapore, 2/27-3/3, 2023. Due to the unclear situation of the pandemic, the conference supported both in-person and virtual participation. 


The conference included a dynamic and comprehensive program, including research papers, tutorials, technical demonstrations, and student research competition. The program also includes workshops that demand dedicated coverage due to their relevance to the current web search and mining research and development, a Doctoral symposium, WSDM cup, and keynote talks by leaders in academia and industry. 


WSDM 2022 had 517 virtual registrants, out of which 156 were from the US. In total, there were 31 countries represented at WSDM 2022: United States, China, Japan, India, United Kingdom, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong (SAR China), Ireland, Israel, Italy, Morocco, Netherlands, Pakistan, Portugal, Qatar, Republic of Korea, Russian Federation, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Singapore, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Vietnam.

WSDM 2023 had 471 participants, where 127 are virtual participants. Among all the participants, 81 were from the US. In total, there were 33 countries represented at WSDM 2023: Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, China, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong SAR, India, Italy, Japan, Kuwait, Luxembourg, Morocco, Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, USA, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Uzbekistan, Vietnam. 

Because WSDM 2022 was changed from the planned in-person meeting to completely virtual meeting, the award search committee decided to use the award to support all the applicants who were studying at a US institute at the conference time and who needs to present a full/short/workshop/tutorial paper at the conference. The remaining balance was used to support students to participant WSDM 2023, which 7 students attended in person. The search committee decided to award all the applicants to cover their major expense.   
In total, this award was used to sponsor 47 US-based students to attend WSDM 2022 and WSDM 2023. It supported 36 students to register for WSDM 2022. It supported 11 students to participate in WSDM 2023, where 7 students attended the conference in person. All the student awardees are matriculated in US institutions. They have actively participated in the conference through presentations, technical demonstrations, and other direct contributions to the WSDM program. 


The broad impacts included training and development of the future generation of leaders and workforce in the increasingly critical field of search and data mining on the Web and the Social Web. 


Here are a few comments from students who have received NSF support for attending the conference:

* "The Travel Award provides a great opportunity to support me in attending such a top venue and sharing my research. I have obtained constructive feedback from the database and data mining community. " (from WSDM 2022 awardee)

* "I really enjoyed the poster session the most, the gather.town event was really interesting and a nice format. I was able to interactively ask questions of the presenters, I was also able to connect with some of the recruiters on the job postings board and some also presented during the conference so that was a great networking opportunity." (from WSDM 2022 awardee)

* "The conference provided me with valuable opportunities to learn about the latest research work and advancements in the field. Additionally, I had the privilege of connecting with many other researchers, fostering valuable networking and knowledge-sharing experiences. " (from WSDM 2023 awardee)

* "This allowed me to showcase my research to the wider scientific community and engage in meaningful networking with fellow researchers in my field. The experience provided valuable insights, fostering connections and discussions that I believe will contribute to the advancement of my work and the field as a whole. " (from WSDM 2023 awardee)


Last Modified: 09/12/2023
Modified by: Huiping Cao
